criteria.name: Market Demand
criteria.description: Evaluates the current demand for application software in various industries.
criteria.reason: Understanding market demand helps in forecasting sales and growth potential.

data_points.name: Total Market Size
data_points.description: The total revenue generated by the application software market.

data_points.name: Growth Rate
data_points.description: The annual growth rate of the application software market.

key_points: Analyze consumer trends in application usage.
Evaluate competitive positioning based on demand.
Track seasonal fluctuations in software adoption.
Consider emerging technologies influencing demand.
Utilize user feedback for demand assessment.

charts.usage: To show market size growth over time, allowing for trend analysis.
To compare the growth rates of different application segments.

criteria.name: User Experience (UX)
criteria.description: Assesses how users interact with the application software and their satisfaction level.
criteria.reason: A positive user experience drives adoption and reduces churn.

data_points.name: User Satisfaction Score
data_points.description: A rating given by users based on their experience.

data_points.name: Net Promoter Score (NPS)
data_points.description: Measures customer loyalty and likelihood to recommend the software.

key_points: Focus on user feedback for continuous improvement.
Ensure accessibility for diverse user groups.
Monitor response times and reliability.
Analyze competitor user experiences.
Implement usability testing before releases.

charts.usage: To compare multiple user experience factors across applications.
To display user satisfaction scores across different demographics.

criteria.name: Innovation Rate
criteria.description: Measures the frequency and impact of new features and updates introduced by companies.
criteria.reason: Frequent innovation can indicate a company's adaptability and future growth potential.

data_points.name: Number of Features Released Annually
data_points.description: Total features introduced by the application in a year.

data_points.name: Investment in R&D
data_points.description: Annual budget allocated for research and development.

key_points: Keep track of industry trends and technologies.
Review competitor innovations regularly.
Evaluate customer demand for new features.
Assess the effectiveness of recent updates.
Monitor user feedback on feature releases.

charts.usage: To visualize the number of features released each year.
To show trends in R&D spending over time.

criteria.name: Market Penetration
criteria.description: Evaluates the share of market held by a specific application software compared to the total industry size.
criteria.reason: High penetration indicates strong competitive positioning and brand recognition.
examples: Share of a leading CRM software in the market

data_points.name: Total Users of Software
data_points.description: Total number of active users for the software.

data_points.name: Total Addressable Market (TAM)
data_points.description: Estimated total revenue opportunity available for the software.

key_points: Identify key competitors in the market.
Assess market entry strategies.
Analyze demographic segments using the software.
Evaluate partnerships that enhance penetration.
Monitor changes in market dynamics regularly.

charts.usage: To display the market share held by different applications.
To show growth in market penetration over time.

criteria.name: Customer Retention Rate
criteria.description: Measures the percentage of customers who continue to use the software over a specific timeframe.
criteria.reason: High retention rates correlate with customer satisfaction and loyalty.

data_points.name: Churn Rate
data_points.description: The percentage of customers who stop using the software within a given period.

data_points.name: Active Users Over Time
data_points.description: Total active users at the end of each month.

key_points: Regularly survey customer feedback.
Analyze reasons behind churn.
Ensure consistent communication with customers.
Monitor competitive changes affecting retention.
Implement loyalty programs to improve retention.

charts.usage: To visualize changes in active users over time.
To compare retention rates across different software products.

criteria.name: Compliance and Security
criteria.description: Evaluates the extent to which software meets regulatory standards and protects user data.
criteria.reason: Compliance is critical for user trust and avoiding legal challenges.

data_points.name: Number of Security Incidents
data_points.description: Total security breaches reported over the past year.

normalized_data_points.name: Compliance Score
normalized_data_points.formula: Number of Compliant Standards / Total Standards

key_points: Stay updated on regulatory changes.
Regularly conduct internal compliance audits.
Educate teams on security best practices.
Develop incident response plans in advance.
Monitor third-party vendor compliance.

charts.usage: To compare compliance levels against benchmarks.
To display trends in security incidents over time.

criteria.name: Cost Efficiency
criteria.description: Evaluates the software's ability to reduce costs for users and companies.
criteria.reason: Cost efficiency affects user retention and market competitiveness.

data_points.name: Customer Cost Savings
data_points.description: Calculated savings for businesses using the software.

data_points.name: Pricing Structure Review
data_points.description: Analysis of subscription vs. one-time payment models.

key_points: Analyze pricing models offered.
Evaluate user feedback on price perception.
Consider cost comparisons with competitors.
Calculate ROI for clients using the software.
Monitor changes in operational costs for improvements.

charts.usage: To show distribution of cost savings among users.
To correlate pricing structures with customer retention.
